switchLanguagePage.prompt: Please select a language to use for this application.

namePage.explanation: This is the name that appears on official identity documents like your birth certificate and passport.

wdywtdtPage.prompt: What would you like to do today?
wdywtdtPage.explanation: Pick one option for now. You can add another option later in the application.
values: Get a card for the first time

prompt.id: Do you plan on using your ID to fly?
prompt.license: Do you plan on using your Driver License to fly?
prompt.card: Do you plan on using your card to fly?

realIdPage.explanation: As of October 1, 2020, you will need a REAL ID compliant driver license or ID card to fly within the United States.

FAQ-whatIsRealID.title: What's a REAL ID compliant card?
FAQ-whatIsRealID.body:
To meet the REAL ID Act, the California DMV will offer two types of cards: a REAL ID compliant card and a federal non-compliant card. Both a REAL ID compliant and a federal non-compliant driver license allow you to legally drive. 

 You need a REAL ID compliant card in order to fly within the U.S or to enter military bases and most federal facilities starting October 1, 2020. 

 Otherwise, you will need a passport or other document accepted by the Transportation Security Administration and the Department of Homeland Security.

FAQ-whatRequiredForRealID.title: What's required to get a REAL ID compliant card?

body.header: You will need 1 of the following:
items: Valid, unexpired U.S. passport or passport card
U.S. Certificate or Consular Report of Birth Abroad
Unexpired foreign passport with valid U.S. visa and approved I-94 form
Certified copy of Birth certificate from a U.S. Territory
Unexpired employment authorization document (EAD) Card (I-766) or valid/expired EAD Card with Notice of Action (I-797 C)
body.otherRequirements: You also need one document that proves you live in California and one document with your Social Security Number such as your Social Security card or Internal Revenue Service form (e.g., W2, 1099, or 1040).

prompt.renew: What type of card are you renewing?
prompt.replace: What type of card are you replacing?
prompt.correctOrUpdate: What type of card are you correcting or updating?

seniorIdPage.prompt: Would you like to get a free Senior Identification Card
seniorIdPage.explanation: If you do not want "Senior Identification Card", you will have to pay the normal fee.

reducedFeePage.prompt: Are you applying for a reduced fee or free ID?
reducedFeePage.licenseExplanation: This only applies to your ID Card. You cannot get a free or reduced fee driver license.

rightFormsSection.prompt: Do you have the right form?
rightFormsSection.explanation: In order to get a reduced fee ID you need to have the Reduced Fee Identification Card Eligibility Verification form (DL 937). To get a free ID you need to have No Fee Identification Card Eligibility Verification (DL 933) form.

FAQ-howToGetForms.title: How do I get these forms?
FAQ-howToGetForms.body: The DMV does not provide these forms. If you get assistance through the government or a non-profit, speak with them about getting a form.

licenseTypePage.prompt: What do you need to drive?

values.label: Housecar, 5th wheel over 15000 pounds, or livestock trailer

endorsementsSection.prompt: Do you need a firefighter endorsement?
endorsementsSection.explanation: If you only want an ambulance certificate, please visit a DMV field office.

getStartedPage.afterComplete: Once you’re done, you will need to visit your local DMV office.

currentCardPage.prompt: If you know it, please enter your California DL/ID card number.
currentCardPage.explanation: Your number can be found at the top of your DL/ID card starting with a letter.

prompt.update: What would you like to update?
prompt.correct: What would you like to correct?

license.explanation: You may need to pay a fee for a new Driver License with these updates.

id.explanation: You may need to pay a fee for a new ID with these updates.

replacementReasonPage.prompt: Why do you need to replace your card?
replacementReasonPage.explanation: Your answer will help DMV employees better assist you.

youthDlNotificationPage.prompt: You must be 15.5 years old to get a learners permit.
youthDlNotificationPage.explanation: If you go to a DMV office sooner to complete your application, you can only apply for a Junior permit. These permits are issued only in exceptional circumstances.
youthDlNotificationPage.question: Would you like to get a California ID card instead?

cantApplyYet.prompt: Because you’re under 15 years old, you can’t apply for a driver license. Would you like to get a California ID card instead?
cantApplyYet.infoMessage: OK, please come back when you turn 14 years old.
